119F090421-d-09-10-04-EJE.Primary Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)
119F090421-d-09-10-04-EJE.Accident Cause: Other general switching rules (Provide detailed  description in narrative)
119F090421-d-09-10-04-EJE.Narrative: CREW WENT INTO YARD TO DIG OUT TILX 12460 SO IT COULD LATER GO TO GARY.  IN DOING SO, THE CREW TIEDONTO THE TRACK AND PULLED IT OUT UNTIL THEY FOUND THE CAR THEY WERE LOOKING FOR WHICH HAPPENED TO BETHE NORTH CAR THEY HAD A HOLD OF.  THE CAR WAS SET TOWARDS SOUTH-20 & THE BALANCE OF THE CARS THEYDIDN`T NEED WERE SHOVED INTO SOUTH-17.  THE CREW FAILED TO REALIZE THAT THERE WERE (6) MORE CARS INSOUTH-17 AT THE NORTH END THAT APPARENTLY WERE COUPLED TO THE NORTH END OF THE CUT THAT THEY HAD JUST PULLED OUT, WITH THE EXCEPTION THAT THE PIN DIDN`T DROP ON THE SOUTH CAR OF THIS SMALLER CUT THE LAST TIME A CREW MADE A JOINT AGAINST IT.  AS A RESULT, WHEN THE CREW PULLED OUT THE CARS THEY HAD AHOLD OF, THE (6) REMAINING CARS IN THE TRACK WERE FREE TO ROLL SOUTH.  THE CREW, NOT REALIZING THIS,BEGAN TO SHOVE THE CAR THEY NEEDED TOWARD SOUTH-20 AND IN THE PROCESS, HAD THE REMAINING  CARS IN SOUTH-17 COLLIDE WITH THE CARS THEY HAD A HOLD OF.  NOTHING DERAILED, HOWEVER, TWO CARS WERE DAMAGED(EJE 90860 AND TIMX 60211).

DRIVER FAILED TO STOP AND CRASHED THROUGH THE DOWNED GATES BEFORE COMING TO A STOP WITH FRONT END OF VEHICLE JUST EAST OF THE EAST SIDE TRACK.  TRAIN WAS UNABLE TO STOP PRIOR TO IMPACT AND DRIVER SUSTAINED FATAL INJURIES.

I0504-d-09-26-04-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Failure to stop train in clear
I0504-d-09-26-04-PATH.Accident Cause: Failure to stop train in clear
I0504-d-09-26-04-PATH.Narrative: THE UTV AND FLAT #27 ALONG WITH THE PETTIBONE AND BUGGY WERE ASSIGNED TO PICK UP SCRAP METAL ON TRACK H NEAR GRAPE.  WORK WAS COMPLETE AND BOTH SETS OF EQUIPMENT WERE OPERATING IN TANDEM TO JOURNAL SQUARE AGAINST TRAFFIC ON TRACK G.  THE PETTIBONE AND BUGGY WAS TRAILING THE UTV AND FLAT#27.  AN EMPLOYEE ON THE ADJACENT TRACK NOTICED A TIE HANGING OFF THE BACK OF THE BUGGY AND NOTIFIED THE CONTROLCENTER.  TRAINMASTER NOTIFIED THE PILOT ON THE PETTIBONE TO STOP AND CORRECT THE POTENTIAL PROBLEM.THE OPERATOR OF THE UTV SLOWED DOWN AFTER HEARING THE TRANSMISSION.  THE PETTIBONE COLLIDED / REARENDED FLAT#27.  THE PETTIBONE AND BUGGY DE-RAILED.  THE TIE PLATES AND EQUIPMENT ON THE BUGGY WERE THROWN ONTO THE TRACK CAUSING ARCING AND POWER SHORTAGE.  THREE EMPLOYEES WERE INJURED AS A RESULT OFTHE INCIDENT.  THE TWO OPERATORS AND TWO PILOTS WERE ALL DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTED.  ALL RESULTS WERENEGATIVE.  THE INCIDENT WAS REPORTED TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER AND ASSIGNED #736409.  ESTIMATED REPAIR OF DAMAGED EQUIPMENT IS $68,395.

192941-d-09-06-04-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT G53 IN EAST YARD AT BRC WAS INSTRUCTED TO SHOVE 43 CARS INTO TRACK 38. CONDUCTOR REQUESTED BRC UMAN TO ASSIST AS THIS WAS ONLY 2ND TRIP ALONE ON THE BRC. AS CREW STARTED TO SHOVE THE CARS WEST CONDUCTOR NOTICED A HEADLIGHT COMING OVERCROSSOVER TOWARD THEIR TAILEND, CAR ICE 66021, WHICH HE WAS RIDING TO PROTECT THE SHOVE. CONDUCTOR IMMEDIATELY DISMOUNTED CAR, GOT IN THE CLEAR WHILE AT THE SAME TIME REQUESTED ENGINEER TO STOP MOVEMENT. MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED BUT NOT BEFORE REAR CAR (ICE 66021) STRUCK LOCOMOTIVES NS 9259 & WC 7507 INCROSSOVER. BRC UMAN CITED WITH RESPONSIBILITY.  NOTIFICATION OF INCIDENT NOT RECEIVED FOR REPORTINGUNTIL 8/25/05 AFTER REQUEST FROM BRC FOR INCIDENT NUMBER AND TRACING FOR DETAILS COMMENCED.

40029-d-09-19-04-TRRA.Narrative: MGALMAD BEGAN SHOVE TOWARD THE SOUTHEND LONG SIDE FOR TRACK #2 WITH CONDUCTOR ON THE POINT.  THE CREW STOPPED FOR CONDUCTOR TO ALIGN SWITCHES FOR TRACK #2.  CONDUCTOR ISSUED A 10-15 CAR MOVEMENT TOWARD ENTRY OF TRACK #2 AND WENT NORTH TO PROTECT THE SHOVE IN VEHICLE.  AFTER RECEIVING CLEARED FOR 40CARS, ENGINEER STATED HE WAS IN THROTTLE 1 OR 2 AND GOING 6-7 MPH.  ENGINEER MADE A REDUCTION UPON HEARING 15 CARS AND GRADUALLY THEREAFTER.  UPON HEARING 3 CARS HE SET MORE BRAKE.  WHEN HE HEARD "THAT WILL DO", ENGINEER STOPPED THE TRAIN AND GOT AN EMERGENCY APPLICATION, NOT KNOWING WHY.  AT THE TIME CONDUCTOR SAID "THAT WILL DO", IT WAS ANTICIPATED THAT SOME SLACK ACTION ROLL OCCURRED, BUT THE STRAIN SUDDENLY STOPPED THE TRAIN.  INSTEAD OF SHOVING ANOTHER 2 OR 3 CAR LENGTHS, CONDUCTOR SAID ITWAS OK WHERE IT STOPPED.  CONDUCTOR TRAVELED BACK SOUTH TO MAKE THE CUT AND WAS TOLD BY THE TRRA YARDMASTER THAT THE TRAIN WAS REPORTED ON THE GROUND BY THE TRRA POLICE OFFICER.

TSB92204-d-09-22-04-TSBY.Narrative:
IMPROPER TRAIN HANDLING WAS THE MAJOR CAUSE FOR THIS DERAILMENT. THE TRAIN CREW HAD PEMISSION TO WYETHEIR LOCOMOTIVE ONLY. THEY WYED THEIR ENTIRE TRAIN. THE ARTICULATED PASSENGER CARS PUSH HARDER ONTHE RAIL THEN OTHER TYPES OF EQUIPMENT.  THE ADDITIONAL STRESS OF THESE CARS CAUSED THE RAIL TO SPREAD, DERAILING TWO OF THE PASSENGER CARS RESULTING IN SEVERE DAMAGE TO THE TRACK, TIES, AND ROADBED.THE LOCOMOTIVE WENT OVER THE DERAILMENT SPOT WITHOUT INCIDENT.

04133-d-09-08-04-URR.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train make-up
04133-d-09-08-04-URR.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train make-up
04133-d-09-08-04-URR.Narrative: CREW WAS ADDING 90 HOPPERS TO THE BOILER HOUSE TRACK FROM THE MUNHALL END (NORTH END).  THERE WERE 86 CARS ON THE TRACK (35 LOADS AND 51 EMPTIES.  CREW COUPLED THE 90 CARS TO THE 86 CARS AND SHOVED SOUTH TO SPOT CAR NEXT TO LOCOMOTIVE AT COAL BIN.  COAL BIN SITS OVER HOPPERS AND WILL NOT CLEAR CAB OF LOCOMOTIVE.  WHEN THE ENGINEER STOPPED MOVEMENT, THE SLACK IN THE 176 CARS RAN OUT AND PULLED THEHOPPERS AND 5 LOCOMOTIVES SOUTH.  WHEN THIS OCCURRED, THE CAB OF LOCOMOTIVE #12 (LOCOMOTIVE NEXT TOHOPPERS) STRUCK THE COAL BIN, DAMAGING BOTH BIN AND CAB OF LOCOMOTIVE.  TRACK LINE UP FROM LOCOMOTIVES WAS 90 EMPTY HOPPERS, 35 LOADED HOPPERS (COAL) AND 50 EMPTY HOPPERS.  ENGINEER HAD LOCOMOTIVE BRAKES APPLIED AND MINIMUM REDUCTION ON CARS WHEN THIS INCIDENT OCCURRED.  NO DERAILMENT/DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT ONLY.

04136-d-09-24-04-URR.Narrative: CREW WAS SHOVING A 70 CAR TRAIN AND CABOOSE (71 CARS TOTAL) NORTH FROM THE DEXTER YARD UP THE DEXTERLEAD WHEN THE 61ST CAR (BLE 51113), 60TH CAR (BLE 65526) AND THE 59TH CAR (BLE 65689) DERAILED AT THE ET #97 SWITCH.  THE DERAILED CARS STRUCK A RAIL CAR STANDING ON #2 PORT PERRY (URR 7592) AND DERAILED THAT CAR.  THE CAR ON #2 PORT PERRY (URR 7592) WHEN IT DERAILED HIT CARS (NW 12662 AND CR 498124) THAT WERE SITTING ON #3 PORT PERRY, DERAILING BOTH.

RE012004-d-09-09-04-VSR.Primary Accident Cause: Switch point gapped (between switch point and stock rail)
RE012004-d-09-09-04-VSR.Accident Cause: Switch point gapped (between switch point and stock rail)
RE012004-d-09-09-04-VSR.Narrative: DURING A SWITCHING MOVEMENT IN THE YARD, THE CREW WAS OPERATING OVER THE EAST SWITCH ON THE #2 SOUTHTRACK.  THE ENTIRE MOVEMENT INVOLVED PUSHING EQUIPMENT INTO THE CUSTOMER SIDING ADJACENT TO THE YARD.  THE WHEELS OF CAR TTZX 861001 SPLIT THE POINTS, ALLOWING THE CAR TO DERAIL IN THE SWITCH.  UPONINVESTIGATION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE NEWLY REPAIRED SWITCH DID NOT RECEIVE SUFFICIENT TAMPING TOPREVENT DIVERGENT MOVMENT OF THE SWITCH POINT AND STOCK RAIL, ALLOWING THE FLANGE OF THE WHEELS TOSPLIT THE POINTS.  THE SWITCH WAS NOT LOCKED AT THE TIME OF SWITCHING AND COULD HAVE HAD A CONTRIBUTING AFFECT BY ALLOWING POINT MOVMENT.  SINCE THE ACCIDENT ALL YARD SWITCHES HAVE BEEN EQUIPPED WITHA LOCK OR LATCH TO PREVENT UNINTENDED MOVMENT OF THE SWITCHPOINTS.  SWITCHES WILL BE MONITORED UNDERLOAD ON A REGULAR BASIS TO DETECT SIMILAR DIVERGENT MOVEMENT AND IDENTIFY SURFACING NEEDS.

04137-d-09-29-04-URR.Primary Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
04137-d-09-29-04-URR.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
04137-d-09-29-04-URR.Narrative: THE TRAIN CREW PULLED A TRAIN IN ON #15 CLASS.  AFTER SECURING THE TRAIN.  THEY PULLED THEIR (2) LOCOMOTIVES NORTH AND STOPPED AT #15 CLASS SWITCH.  BRAKEMAN LINED SWITCH FOR LADDER AND GAVE ENGINEERA HAND SIGNAL TO MOVE SOUTH UP THE LADDER TRACK.  THE CREW WAS TO PROCEED SOUTH UP #23 CLASS.  THE BRAKEMAN WAS RIDING ON THE SOUTH UNIT (#28) THIS WAS THE LEAD UNIT MOVING SOUTH.  HE WAS POSITIONED ON THE WEST SET OF STEPS OF LOCOMOTIVE #28.  THE ENGINEER WAS OPERATING FROM THE NORTH LOCOMOTIVE (#22).  ENGINEERS SEAT IS ALSO ON WEST SIDE OF LOCOMOTIVE.  AS LITE LOCOMOTIVES WERE MOVING SOUTH, THELEAD UNIT #22 STRUCK THE CORNER OF CAR (KEYX 8048) THAT WAS ON #22 CLASS BUT FOULING THE LADDER TRACK.  DAMAGE TO BOTH LOCOMOTIVE #22 AND KEYX 8049.  IMPACT OCCURRED ON THE EASTSIDE OF LOCOMOTIVE #22OPPOSITE SIDE OF WHERE BRAKEMAN WAS POSITIONED.  BRAKEMAN FAILED TO OBSERVE CARS FOULING LADDER TRACK.  ENGINEER D/A TESTED AND QUICK TEST.  ALL COMPANY REASONABLE CAUSE.  BRAKEMAN DESERTED ASSIGNMENTBEFORE SUPERVISOR WAS ABLE TO INTERVIEW AND TEST.
